channel.title: How to make/add your own costum items to your client in 9simple steps[REPOST]
channel.description:
[size=30pt]ALL CREDITS TO VARMISHER5150[/size]
MY FIRST TUTORIAL
Difficulty: 7/10 Description: How to add your own custom clients. Classes modified: class8.java
lets get started
First as we all know we want to have a client
If you don't then go here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,304353.0/topicseen.html
That would be a client tutorial on setup and download.
Now once you have your client set up and ready to go make sure you have your class8.java and a Models folder
you will be needing is: Metasequoia, Datmaker, 7zZip, and RsModel Viewer
Here are the downloads.
RAPIDSHARE
Metasequoia - http://rapidshare.com/files/159165205/Metasequoia.rar.html
DatMaker - http://rapidshare.com/files/159165782/Datmaker.rar.html
7zZip - http://rapidshare.com/files/159166014/7-Zip.rar.html
RsModel Viewer - http://rapidshare.com/files/159167387/rs_model_viewer.rar.html
Item Model Id's - http://rapidshare.com/files/159167885/item_model_list.rar.html
MEDIAFIRE
Metasequoia - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?mrom2t1yotd
DatMaker - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2fnyozjtfzn
7zZip - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?z1hfjclozzz
RsModel Viewer - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?yynmozd55r2
Item Model Id's - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?bokmdday2mi
[b]STEP 1[/b]
You will use your Metasequoia program to create a item that you will want in your server.
I will be creating a New Sword for this Tutorial.
Now open up Metasequoia and it should look like this:
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/24nqv84.jpg[/img]
Now you will need to open up your Datmaker and your Item Model Id list to get a base for your Item they both should look like this:
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/33tjdkg.jpg[/img]
[b]STEP 2[/b]
Now what you will need to do next is look for a Item Model so in this case I'm going to use Silver Light as a Start off base for Meta so I will need to Crtl+F Silver Light. The Model Id will be the Male and Female Equip Shown Here
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/9u868o.jpg[/img]
Look where it says
[code]class8.anInt165 = 513;//Male Wield View class8.anInt200 = 513;//Female Wield View[/code]
You will need to remember the 513. Not for long just for about 30 seconds.
[b]STEP 3[/b]
Now you will need to choose a folder directory for your custom models on Datmaker. For Example I simply made a new folder and named it Models in my Metasequoia Folder.
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/5tkwk.jpg[/img]
Now that the Model folder in your Metasequoia Directory has been created, on DatMaker go File, Open Folder, Metasequoia Directory, Model Folder.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/vpjajn.jpg[/img]
Now that that's done we can move on.
[b]STEP 4[/b]
Now that we know what the model ID for Silver Light is (513) We will use DatMaker to open it up. Go to File, Open, Go to your RsModel Viewer Directory
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/142d948.jpg[/img]
Go To Model
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/o8evsp.jpg[/img]
Then you will open up your RsModel Viewer's Model Folder
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/24vnrew.jpg[/img]
And find model 513 and open it and it should show like this on your DatMaker
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/zkom55.jpg[/img]
Now on DatMaker you will go to File, Export, then MQO
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/2mrh1jr.jpg[/img]
And Click you just made it Metasequoia Compatible.
[b]STEP 5[/b]
Now you will want to open that file to get started off with making your item. So go to your Metasequoia and go to File, Open, RsModel Folder Directory
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/2mplroh.jpg[/img]
Then Models and it should have a file called 513.mqo
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2rrx74i.jpg[/img]
Open it then BAM it should look like this on Metasequoia.
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/2lvfghy.jpg[/img]
Now you may edit it as you freely wish but I'm not going to show you how to use Meta on this Tutorial. You should find out for yourself so that way you can Learn to use it not just use by the handbook. Its really easy to learn and once you have gotten it down it's like you have used this program since birth. Explore with it. :)
[b]ALSO - You need to make 2 different models a Wield model and a Drop Model.[/b]
Here's what mine is going to look like.
[b]WIELD MODEL[/b]
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/142hf5y.jpg[/img]
[b]DROP MODEL[/b]
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/1zybz3d.jpg[/img]
Once you are done [b]Save As[/b] them both to your [b]Meta, Models Folder[/b]. [b]P.S![/b] I would do it in someway i have it like mine because you will need to know which one is which. Example - Wield(Saved As) Purple LightW, Drop(Saved As) Purple LightD
[b]SAVE AS WIELD[/b]
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/1zxo5sy.jpg[/img]
[b]SAVE AS DROP[/b]
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/33el7qd.jpg[/img]
Once you have done that now its time to open 7Zip [b](Open the Program that says 7zFM)[/b] which should look like this
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/1fjo8z.jpg[/img]
Now go back to your Datmaker and on the Control Panel to the left look for Directory List. You should see your Item you just created there if not look for the Refresh button and click it.
[IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/8x7ntw.jpg[/img]
Now you should see your item in your directory list if you followed my directions. If you do see it click it and it should show up with your item.
[b]WIELD MODEL[/b]
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/30ws7k9.jpg[/img]
[b]DROP MODEL[/b]
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/6fxgeb.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 6[/b]
Now you need to turn those into .dat
We will start off with the wielding model. So select your Wield Model and at the top of your Datmaker click the priorities box (its next to a green box) and it should come up on your DatMaker Graph saying something like PRIORITY FLAG = 10 in green.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/24104k0.jpg[/img]
Now next to the [b]"Make .Dat"[/b] button will be a little box with the number [b]0[/b] in it that's where your Priority Flag Number goes. In my box I'm going to put 10. [b](IMPORTANT! If your item did not come up with a priority flag number just use the number 10) [/b]
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/33wvzmv.jpg[/img]
Once that is done since it its a [b]WIELD MODEL[/b], at the bottom left of your DatMaker above the button [b]"Make .Dat"[/b] should be a little box that says [b]"No Anim"[/b] change it to Right Hand.
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/2i266pi.jpg[/img]
Now you can press the [b]Make .Dat[/b] button and that item will come up as .dat in your Metasequoia's, Model Folder.
Now for the [b]Drop Model[/b]. Everything you did for the Wield model you do for the drop model [b]EXCEPT FOR ONE THING![/b] where you have it changed to Right Hand, [b]You need to change it back to No Anim![/b]
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/j8cx0i.jpg[/img]
[b]STEP 7[/b]
Once you have that done bring up your 7Zip program and your Meta's Model Folder and look for those two .Dat files you just created. Once you have found it Drag them over to your 7Zip Program and Convert them to a .Gzip. [b](It should automatically bring up the converting window as soon as you drag them over)[/b]
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/i5tzdj.jpg[/img]
Once you are done you should have two files sitting in your 7Zip like this
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/20qbnt.jpg[/img]
Once done open up your [b]CLIENTS[/b] Model Folder and Drag the Models you have in your 7Zip Program over to the Client's Model Folder.
Once in there rename both your Wield model and Drop Model to a Model number. It can be anything from 11000 - 15000 nothing higher (I Think) or else it wont work. [b]IMPORTANT! You need to know which one is the Drop Model and Which one is the Wield Model for your ints![/b]
Mine are [b]WIELD MODEL - 12056, DROP MODEL - 12057[/b]
[IMG]http://i36.tinypic.com/24fyyqb.jpg[/img]
Once you have done that now its time for the Ints.
[b]STEP 8[/b]
To add the ints you will need to open your Clients Class8.java.
No do Ctrl+F and look for this
[code]class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);[/code]
[IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/2vafdkg.jpg[/img]
Under that is where you would add the Ints.
If it is a Weapon (In This Case it is) Your Ints will look something Like this
[code] if(i == Item Number) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = Wield Model Number;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = Wield Model Number;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Item Name";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Examine Info".getBytes();//examin info } [/code]
If it is Armor then your Ints will look like this
[code] if(i == Item Number) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number; // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.anInt181 = 1000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 470; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 129; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -1; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt165 = Wear Model Number;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = Wear Model Number;//female wearing class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Item Name";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Examine Info".getBytes();//examin info }[/code]
Now Since we have my Purple Light as an example this is what it would look like if my [b]WIELD[/b] is 12056 and my [b]DROP[/b] is 12057
[code] if(i == 19522) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = 12057; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 12056;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = 12056;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Purple Light";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "TuT Item for Moparscape.".getBytes();//examin info } [/code]
Then once you have that done Close your Class8.java and Compile your Client.
[b]STEP 9[/b]
After Compiling Run it and Enter your Server. Once in you must say [code]add model 12056 add model 12057[/code]
It should say Model Successfully found.
Once it says that then your item is ready just do ::pickup (whatever you numbered your item) (amount)
Then BAM your first ever item :D
[b]THE END[/b] [size=30pt]ALL CREDITS TO VARMISHER5150[/size]

item.title: How to make/add your own costum items to your client in 9simple steps[REPOST]
item.dc:creator: @skillerz skillerz
item.description:
@skillerz wrote:

[size=30pt]ALL CREDITS TO VARMISHER5150[/size]

MY FIRST TUTORIAL

Difficulty: 7/10
Description: How to add your own custom clients.
Classes modified: class8.java

lets get started

First as we all know we want to have a client

If you don’t then go here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,304353.0/topicseen.html

That would be a client tutorial on setup and download.

Now once you have your client set up and ready to go make sure you have your class8.java and a Models folder

you will be needing is: Metasequoia, Datmaker, 7zZip, and RsModel Viewer

Here are the downloads.

RAPIDSHARE

Metasequoia - http://rapidshare.com/files/159165205/Metasequoia.rar.html

DatMaker - http://rapidshare.com/files/159165782/Datmaker.rar.html

7zZip - http://rapidshare.com/files/159166014/7-Zip.rar.html

RsModel Viewer - http://rapidshare.com/files/159167387/rs_model_viewer.rar.html

Item Model Id’s - http://rapidshare.com/files/159167885/item_model_list.rar.html

MEDIAFIRE

Metasequoia - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?mrom2t1yotd

DatMaker - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2fnyozjtfzn

7zZip - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?z1hfjclozzz

RsModel Viewer - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?yynmozd55r2

Item Model Id’s - http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?bokmdday2mi

STEP 1

You will use your Metasequoia program to create a item that you will want in your server.

I will be creating a New Sword for this Tutorial.

Now open up Metasequoia and it should look like this:

24nqv84.jpg1024×768

Now you will need to open up your Datmaker and your Item Model Id list to get a base for your Item they both should look like this:

33tjdkg.jpg1024×768

STEP 2

Now what you will need to do next is look for a Item Model so in this case I’m going to use Silver Light as a Start off base for Meta so I will need to Crtl+F Silver Light. The Model Id will be the Male and Female Equip Shown Here

9u868o.jpg1024×768

Look where it says

class8.anInt165 = 513;//Male Wield View class8.anInt200 = 513;//Female Wield View

You will need to remember the 513. Not for long just for about 30 seconds.

STEP 3

Now you will need to choose a folder directory for your custom models on Datmaker. For Example I simply made a new folder and named it Models in my Metasequoia Folder.

5tkwk.jpg1024×768

Now that the Model folder in your Metasequoia Directory has been created, on DatMaker go File, Open Folder, Metasequoia Directory, Model Folder.

vpjajn.jpg1024×768

Now that that’s done we can move on.

STEP 4

Now that we know what the model ID for Silver Light is (513) We will use DatMaker to open it up. Go to File, Open, Go to your RsModel Viewer Directory

142d948.jpg1024×768

Go To Model

o8evsp.jpg1024×768

Then you will open up your RsModel Viewer’s Model Folder

24vnrew.jpg1024×768

And find model 513 and open it and it should show like this on your DatMaker

zkom55.jpg1024×768

Now on DatMaker you will go to File, Export, then MQO

2mrh1jr.jpg1024×768

And Click you just made it Metasequoia Compatible.

STEP 5

Now you will want to open that file to get started off with making your item. So go to your Metasequoia and go to File, Open, RsModel Folder Directory

2mplroh.jpg1024×768

Then Models and it should have a file called 513.mqo

2rrx74i.jpg1024×768

Open it then BAM it should look like this on Metasequoia.

2lvfghy.jpg1024×768

Now you may edit it as you freely wish but I’m not going to show you how to use Meta on this Tutorial. You should find out for yourself so that way you can Learn to use it not just use by the handbook. Its really easy to learn and once you have gotten it down it’s like you have used this program since birth. Explore with it.

ALSO - You need to make 2 different models a Wield model and a Drop Model.

Here’s what mine is going to look like.

WIELD MODEL

142hf5y.jpg1024×768

DROP MODEL

1zybz3d.jpg1024×768

Once you are done Save As them both to your Meta, Models Folder. P.S! I would do it in someway i have it like mine because you will need to know which one is which. Example - Wield(Saved As) Purple LightW, Drop(Saved As) Purple LightD

SAVE AS WIELD

1zxo5sy.jpg1024×768

SAVE AS DROP

33el7qd.jpg1024×768

Once you have done that now its time to open 7Zip (Open the Program that says 7zFM) which should look like this

1fjo8z.jpg1024×768

Now go back to your Datmaker and on the Control Panel to the left look for Directory List. You should see your Item you just created there if not look for the Refresh button and click it.

8x7ntw.jpg1024×768

Now you should see your item in your directory list if you followed my directions. If you do see it click it and it should show up with your item.

WIELD MODEL

30ws7k9.jpg1024×768

DROP MODEL

6fxgeb.jpg1024×768

Step 6

Now you need to turn those into .dat

We will start off with the wielding model. So select your Wield Model and at the top of your Datmaker click the priorities box (its next to a green box) and it should come up on your DatMaker Graph saying something like PRIORITY FLAG = 10 in green.

24104k0.jpg1024×768

Now next to the “Make .Dat” button will be a little box with the number 0 in it that’s where your Priority Flag Number goes. In my box I’m going to put 10. (IMPORTANT! If your item did not come up with a priority flag number just use the number 10)

33wvzmv.jpg1024×768

Once that is done since it its a WIELD MODEL, at the bottom left of your DatMaker above the button “Make .Dat” should be a little box that says “No Anim” change it to Right Hand.

2i266pi.jpg1024×768

Now you can press the Make .Dat button and that item will come up as .dat in your Metasequoia’s, Model Folder.

Now for the Drop Model. Everything you did for the Wield model you do for the drop model EXCEPT FOR ONE THING! where you have it changed to Right Hand, You need to change it back to No Anim!

j8cx0i.jpg1024×768

STEP 7

Once you have that done bring up your 7Zip program and your Meta’s Model Folder and look for those two .Dat files you just created. Once you have found it Drag them over to your 7Zip Program and Convert them to a .Gzip. (It should automatically bring up the converting window as soon as you drag them over)

i5tzdj.jpg1024×768

Once you are done you should have two files sitting in your 7Zip like this

20qbnt.jpg1024×768

Once done open up your CLIENTS Model Folder and Drag the Models you have in your 7Zip Program over to the Client’s Model Folder.

Once in there rename both your Wield model and Drop Model to a Model number. It can be anything from 11000 - 15000 nothing higher (I Think) or else it wont work. IMPORTANT! You need to know which one is the Drop Model and Which one is the Wield Model for your ints!

Mine are WIELD MODEL - 12056, DROP MODEL - 12057

Once you have done that now its time for the Ints.

STEP 8

To add the ints you will need to open your Clients Class8.java.

No do Ctrl+F and look for this

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

2vafdkg.jpg1024×768

Under that is where you would add the Ints.

If it is a Weapon (In This Case it is) Your Ints will look something Like this

if(i == Item Number) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = Wield Model Number;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = Wield Model Number;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Item Name";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Examine Info".getBytes();//examin info }

If it is Armor then your Ints will look like this

if(i == Item Number) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = Drop Model Number; // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.anInt181 = 1000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 470; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 129; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = -1; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt165 = Wear Model Number;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = Wear Model Number;//female wearing class8.anInt204 = 28; class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Item Name";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Examine Info".getBytes();//examin info }

Now Since we have my Purple Light as an example this is what it would look like if my WIELD is 12056 and my DROP is 12057

if(i == 19522) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = 12057; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 2000; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 25; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 12056;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = 12056;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Purple Light";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "TuT Item for Moparscape.".getBytes();//examin info }

Then once you have that done Close your Class8.java and Compile your Client.

STEP 9

After Compiling Run it and Enter your Server. Once in you must say

add model 12056 add model 12057

It should say Model Successfully found.

Once it says that then your item is ready just do ::pickup (whatever you numbered your item) (amount)

Then BAM your first ever item

THE END
[size=30pt]ALL CREDITS TO VARMISHER5150[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: How to make/add your own costum items to your client in 9simple steps[REPOST]
